intro: Cryptantha wigginsii, commonly known as Wiggins' bluecurls, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its blue or purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in desert or semi-desert environments. It has hairy stems and leaves, which help reduce water loss in arid conditions. Cryptantha wigginsii is a perennial species that plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat.
